name: audaciousness
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
behaviour that shows a willingness to take risks or offend people: Many voters were shocked by the audaciousness of the candidate, but some found his style refreshing. His audaciousness in the final minutes won him the race. See
audacious
More examplesFewer examplesThe committee was surprised at the audaciousness of the request for more funding when the start-up’s financial records were in such poor order.I was amused by the boy's sheer audaciousness in insisting on an interview.No one who had heard him speak before was surprised by his audaciousness.The film has an over-the-top, pulp fiction-inspired audaciousness but it’s a lot of fun to watch.
